column1: People with COPD tend to have more health problems than people who do not have COPD.
If you have COPD, you are more likely to have: - Repeat infections, such as pneumonia.
COPD increases your risk of colds, the flu, and hospital stays due to lung infection.
- High blood pressure in the lungs.
COPD may cause high blood pressure in the arteries that bring blood to your lungs.
COPD increases your risk of heart attack, heart failure, chest pain, irregular heartbeat, and blood clots.
Certain COPD medicines also may cause bone loss.
